Docs.summary: Constructor using a context and theme for this builder and the it creates.

remarks.para: Constructor using a context and theme for this builder and the it creates. The actual theme that an AlertDialog uses is a private implementation, however you can here supply either the name of an attribute in the theme from which to get the dialog's style (such as or one of the constants , , or .

Docs.summary: A constructor used when creating managed representations of JNI objects; called by the runtime.

remarks.para: This constructor is invoked by the runtime infrastructure () to create a new managed representation for a Java Native Interface object.
The constructor will initializes the property of the new instance using and .

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.Content.Context Context { get; }
.property instance class Android.Content.Context Context

Docs.summary: Returns a with the appropriate theme for dialogs created by this Builder.

remarks.para: Returns a with the appropriate theme for dialogs created by this Builder. Applications should use this Context for obtaining LayoutInflaters for inflating views that will be used in the resulting dialogs, as it will cause views to be inflated with the correct theme.

Docs.summary: Creates a with the arguments supplied to this builder.

remarks.para: Creates a with the arguments supplied to this builder. It does not the dialog. This allows the user to do any extra processing before displaying the dialog. Use if you don't have any other processing to do and want this to be created and displayed.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual Android.App.AlertDialog.Builder SetMultiChoiceItems (Java.Lang.ICharSequence[] items, bool[] checkedItems, Android.Content.IDialogInterfaceOnMultiChoiceClickListener listener);

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.AlertDialog/Builder SetMultiChoiceItems(class Java.Lang.ICharSequence[] items, bool[] checkedItems, class Android.Content.IDialogInterfaceOnMultiChoiceClickListener listener) cil managed

Docs.param: the text of the items to be displayed in the list.
specifies which items are checked. It should be null in which case no items are checked. If non null it must be exactly the same length as the array of items.

notified when an item on the list is clicked. The dialog will not be dismissed when an item is clicked. It will only be dismissed if clicked on a button, if no buttons are supplied it's up to the user to dismiss the dialog.
Docs.summary: Set a list of items to be displayed in the dialog as the content, you will be notified of the selected item via the supplied listener.

remarks.para: Set a list of items to be displayed in the dialog as the content, you will be notified of the selected item via the supplied listener. The list will have a check mark displayed to the right of the text for each checked item. Clicking on an item in the list will not dismiss the dialog. Clicking on a button will dismiss the dialog.

specifies which items are checked. It should be null in which case no items are checked. If non null it must be exactly the same length as the array of items.

notified when an item on the list is clicked. The dialog will not be dismissed when an item is clicked. It will only be dismissed if clicked on a button, if no buttons are supplied it's up to the user to dismiss the dialog.

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.AlertDialog/Builder SetOnCancelListener(class Android.Content.IDialogInterfaceOnCancelListener onCancelListener) cil managed

Docs.summary: Sets the callback that will be called if the dialog is canceled.

remarks.para: Sets the callback that will be called if the dialog is canceled.

Even in a cancelable dialog, the dialog may be dismissed for reasons other than being canceled or one of the supplied choices being selected. If you are interested in listening for all cases where the dialog is dismissed and not just when it is canceled, see .

.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance class Android.App.AlertDialog/Builder SetSingleChoiceItems(int32 itemsId, int32 checkedItem, class Android.Content.IDialogInterfaceOnClickListener listener) cil managed

Docs.param: the resource id of an array i.e. R.array.foo
specifies which item is checked. If -1 no items are checked.

notified when an item on the list is clicked. The dialog will not be dismissed when an item is clicked. It will only be dismissed if clicked on a button, if no buttons are supplied it's up to the user to dismiss the dialog.
Docs.summary: Set a list of items to be displayed in the dialog as the content, you will be notified of the selected item via the supplied listener.

remarks.para: Set a list of items to be displayed in the dialog as the content, you will be notified of the selected item via the supplied listener. This should be an array type i.e. R.array.foo The list will have a check mark displayed to the right of the text for the checked item. Clicking on an item in the list will not dismiss the dialog. Clicking on a button will dismiss the dialog.

MemberSignature.Value: protected override Type ThresholdType { get; }
.property instance class System.Type ThresholdType

Docs.summary: This API supports the Mono for Android infrastructure and is not intended to be used directly from your code.
Docs.value: A which provides the declaring type.

remarks.para: This property is used to control virtual vs. non virtual method dispatch against the underlying JNI object. When this property is equal to the declaring type, then virtual method invocation against the JNI object is performed; otherwise, we assume that the method was overridden by a derived type, and perform non-virtual methdo invocation.
